index.dscr: This JavaScript-based tool provides visualization for WBSC Scoring System to help new scorers adopting it. Use GUI elements to create a baseball/softball game situation, then click the 'Score play' button to see how it shall be scored. If you want to store the result, use the 'Download image' button. If something is wrong, feel free to report it.
index.license: This software is distributed under UNLICENSE. This means the tool and its output is absolutely free to use for everyone for any purpose. You don't have to ask for any permission, nor you have to credit the author. However, if you want to, it would be appreciated :)
index.endorse: Also, if you happen to like this thing, please spread your word about it to help it reach other potential users.

validation.noSBAdvance: 'Stolen base' may not result into further advance.
validation.noE2TSB: Catcher may not be credited with an error when trying to catch runner stealing, unless there is further advance due to it.
validation.noSelfAsist: A fielder cannot assist directly to self.
validation.noMultipleAsist: A fielder cannot have more than 1 assist in a play.
validation.max3Outs: There cannot be more than 3 outs in one play.
validation.noOutAfterOut: One player cannot be out more than once.
validation.noAdvanceAfterOut: Player cannot advance further after being out.
validation.advanceInOrder: Extra advances of one runner must happen in order.
validation.noSameBase: Two runners cannot finish on the same base.
validation.noHitAndFO: It is not possible to score a HIT, if there is a forced out, use 'FC - Occupied' instead.
validation.noHitAndA: It is not possible to score a HIT, if there is an appeal play, use 'FC - Occupied' instead.
validation.notFO2: Force out at 2nd is not possible, because the runner from 1st is not forced to advance.
validation.notFO3: Force out at 3rd is not possible, because the runner from 2nd is not forced to advance.
validation.notFOH: Force out at Home is not possible, because the runner from 3rd is not forced to advance.
validation.noDistantFO: Force out is only possible at the closest base to advance on.
validation.missingOPlay: FC - occupied is selected, but corresponding out/decessive error is missing.
validation.missingFCPlay: FC is selected, but corresponding runner advance is missing.
validation.missingPBPlay: If strikeout with FC is selected, there must be a passed ball credited to a runner.
validation.missingGDPPlay: GDP is selected, but corresponding out/decessive error is missing.
validation.missingSHPlay: SH is selected, but no runner advanced by batter.
validation.missingSFPlay: SF is selected, but no runner advanced by batter.
validation.missingSFRun: SF is selected, but no runner scored.
validation.noSBCS: SB is not possible, when another runner was CS, use 'FC - indifference'.
validation.noWPAfterPlay: WP cannot happen after another play (except for SB and BB).
validation.noPBAfterPlay: PB cannot happen after another play (except for SB and BB).
validation.noPlayAfterIP: IP must be the only runner play at the moment.
validation.noPlayAfterBK: BK must be the only runner play at the moment.

project.title: DESCRIPTION
project.p1: WBSC Scoring Creator is a JavaScript-based program allows selecting combination of plays that may occur in baseball/softball game to visualize the way of scoring such play in WBSC scoring system. It is meant both for individual scorers for learning and revising and for tutors to help them build up educational materials for clinics.
project.p2: For more information about how to use the program, see User manual.
project.p3: The project is maintained and developed voluntarily by a dedicated scorer who happens to know a thing or two about programming as well. However, it will take long before it reaches ideal shape, if ever. Shall you encounter any incorrect or odd behaviur or something that is missing and should be also included, don't hesitate to contact the author - either directly via my email or you can use GitHub interface for creating new report/question/suggestion directly there. If you do so, try to describe your issue, so it can be addressed. Screenshots are useful to see what is happening. You may want to check our reporting bug guide for details.
project.p4: This program is still evolving. Visit the "TO-DO" section in Project overview to check what is yet planned to be implemented. Refer to the "Limitations" list to see what is certainly not possible atm.
project.p5: This is an Unlicensed open-source that can be found HERE. Any help with further development would be appreciated, but you can as well take the source code and do whatever you want with it yourself.

limitations.title: Limitations
limitations.subtitle: (not planned to be implemented soon)
limitations.dscr: There are several features of WBSC scoring system that are currently not covered by this program. They may be included in some future releases, but no promises.
limitations.list:
• It is not possible to specify actions leading to runners appearing on bases (except TIE). The actuall action is always replaced with a red asterisk.
  • It is not possible to specify the batting order of the batter and previous runners. Output always starts from 1.
  • It is not possible to get different number of Ks and BBs than 1
  • Actions are limited to up to 3 assists (followed by an out or an error). This is mainly to avoid practical problems with rendering more numbers.
  • No 10th player (additional outfielder) for slowpitch. However, it is quite probable this will be eventually added.
  • Not covering possible Baseball5 features. This is because Baseball5 system is very different and non-compatible. If you're interested, here is the official WBSC document covering the Baseball5 scoring system.
  • Not covering substitutions and statistical outputs. It doesn't quite make sense to include them into the app mechanic. However, it is planned to add dedicated static articles covering these two topics.

help.title: WORKING WITH WBSC SCORING CREATOR
help.dscr: The basic idea is pretty simple - you build up your input and when you hit "Score play", the outcome will be displayed in the "Output" section. It is designed to look like (blue) WBSC paper scoresheet to give the most precise experience of how similar action should be written down watching the game on the field. A couple of validations run above the input to avoid impossible plays or at least make them less probable.
help.premises: There are a few premises to have in mind:
help.premise1: The program always renders only ONE PLAY AT ONCE. It may consist of more situations (theoretically up to 10 separate actions), but all of them are meant to happen during the same pitch (or the same time between pitches). You cannot follow the flow of a game.
help.premise2: Due to the above runner being placed on base is indicated with a red asterisk mark. This is no official scoring abbreviation, it is just to indicate there was SOME play, but we don't cover it and don't care about it. The only exception from this is a potential tiebreaker (TIE) run, because this is an arbitrary action.
help.premise3: Batting order always starts from 1. Depending on the number of players involved, the output can show players 1-4. It is neither possible to select different initial order, nor skip some players in between.

basics.title: Basics
basics.p1: When you enter the site, you'll see a basic input prepared to put in batter's action:
basics.p2: Underneath there is basic output form consisting of empty scoresheet element and the "Download image" button:

first.title: Entering first play
first.p1: Note you cannot select from Run combo-box by default, because it requires a play that ends up safe at home base. This option will be covered later in more advanced topics.
first.p2: You start by picking an option from the first Action combo-box containing groups of possible situations. Internally this is called a "base action":
first.p3: Based on the selection the second combo-box becomes active and being filled with concrete plays. This is called a "specific action". The options are grouped into "safe" and "out" situations:
first.p4: Third element of every action is called Involved. This means defensive player position(s) or locations on the field (in certain cases). The availability of those UI elements depends on specific action selection. For some plays there is no additional information allowed, for some there is exactly one or exactly two options. For the rest you can select 1-4. You add new inputs with green "+P" button and remove them with red "-P" button. When it is not possible to add/remove inputs, the buttons are not enabled.
first.p5: Once you are ready to render the output of your play, hit the blue "Score play" button:
first.p6: The outcome will be printed into the scoresheet:
first.p7: You can download the result to preserve it either by right clicking it and pick up from the context menu or by the green "Download image" button:

runners.title: Advanced - Runners
runners.p1: Actions are not limited to batter only. There is a toolbar that allows you picking up which players were involved:
runners.p2: The buttons are labeled "B" for the batter and "R1-R3" for the runners starting at respective base. When any of the buttons is selected, it has red color and "-" before the label. Corresponding set of inputs is rendered. Buttons that are green with "+" before the label mean that position is currently not used. Clicking on any of the buttons will alter its state. E.g. clicking on "+R1" will result into:
runners.p3: Another click will hide it again. You can choose any combination with or without the batter and with or without the runners. The only requirement is to have at least one player selected.
runners.p4: Runner's input is slightly different from the batter's and there are also minor differences between the bases. The selection of base and specific actions is adjusted to show relevant plays.
runners.p5: For 1st and 2nd base. There is a "Tiebreak" checkbox. If it is checked, runner doesn't appear on base with generic red asterisk, but instead the symbol TIE is used (which is how WBSC scores tiebreaker runners).
runners.p6: From the "Base" combo-box you pick the base that runner gains with current action. Obviously, the options are adjusted depending on which base we are currently on. If you need a runner to stay on the current base, you don't do it here, but instead you pick "No advance" from the "Action" menu.
runners.p7: If a play resulting into a safe situation at home plate is selected, combo-box "Run" becomes active. Then you pick from "Earned" / "Unearned" / "Team unearned" options. This feature is here mainly to show differences between each variant. There are some basic validations, but during the game it depends on a broader context of previous plays, while here we always score just one separate action. "Run" is also possible directly for the batter, but only for "Hit - Home run" plays.

extra.title: Advanced - Extra inputs
extra.p1: If needed, there can be more than one situation chained together with the initial action. You can use green "+" button under "Involved" section to render new group of inputs:
extra.p2: The box with new inputs renders directly below:
extra.p3: If you change your mind, you hide and thus disable extra inputs with red "-" button:
extra.p4: For the batter there can be up to 3 extra inputs (one situation at each base). If you decide to remove them again, you have to start from the last (only the last "-" button is enabled). For the runners, the number of possible extra inputs logically decreases as the home plate is getting closer (0-2 for 1st base, 0-1 for 2nd base and none for 3rd base, as the first action already moved that runner home). The selection of actions is naturally different for the batter (becoming batter runner) and the other runners. The other functions are the same.

reset.title: Advanced - Reset form
reset.p1: You can use the yellow "Clear" button to quickly reset inputs into initial state with simple batter's action input only and everything cleared.

import.title: Advanced - Import/Export input selection
import.p1: You can use purple "Export selection" button to save the current selection and store it for later re-use. The file will be exported in .json format. Inputs can be exported anytime regardless of the validity.
import.p2: Using the purple "Import selection" button you can upload a previously exported .json file. Providing it is a valid file, it will be parsed and transferred into corresponding input selection and the situation will be re-generated. Validation error may be triggered.
import.p3: With the last purple "Import from library" button you can pick from our ever-growing collection of prepared situations. They are stored .json files, like the custom user inputs/outputs. Upon selection it will be parsed and transferred into corresponding input selection and the situation will be re-generated. This feature is meant to speed up the process of generating new images, if needed, and to help new users to better understand what is possible to achieve.

report.title: REPORTING BUGS
report.motto: In every computer program there is at least one bug.
report.p1: This saying might be a little exaggerated, but generally it is quite hard to keep any application error prone. I am doing my best developing "WBSC Scoring", also having quite solid bunch of automated tests with dozens of situations to test every time before I add/update/fix something, but basically I am sure there are still mistakes hidden around and waiting to be discovered. And if not mistakes, then you'll probably come up with some "nice to have" new features I haven't thought about yet.
report.p2: I am ready for all your input. Here on this page, you can find details about the reporting process.

issues.title: GitHub issues
issues.p1: GitHub provides a simple, yet sufficient bug/feature tracking system, which is being used for this project.
issues.p2: You can find all the issues related to "WBSC Scoring" HERE. The default filter shows opened issues, that are known to me, but are about to be dealt with yet.
issues.p3: If you are familiar with GitHub, feel free to open a new issue on your own. I will try to address it ASAP.

manual.title: Manual reporting
manual.p1: If you're not sure how to deal with GitHub, you are of course welcome traditional ways of communication.
manual.p2: The best option is to write me an email to alois.seckar{'@'}gmail.com.
manual.p3: Alternative ways of contacting me via social media are listed HERE.

howto.title: What to include in the report?
howto.dscr: To be able to track down the issue I urge you to keep some basic structure of the reports with all the necessary details attached. Please always try to include following points:
howto.subject: What is wrong?
howto.subjectDscr: A brief, yet meaningful explanation of what seems to be broken/malfunctioning.
howto.repoductionDscr: A sequence of user steps and interactions leading to the situation. This is important, because some things depend on the exact order of things, and I might not be able to do it the same way unless you tell me how.
howto.screenshotsDscr1: A visualization of the problem often speaks for itself. Actually, good screenshots may be worth more than the text explanation alone.
howto.screenshotsDscr2: I would be interested in the picture of the output (to see what is wrong), but also (and MAINLY) of the inputs, because the cause may often be hidden right there. Please always try to attach them.
howto.consoleDscr: This is an advanced topic, but it can also help me a lot. If you press F12 in most of the browsers (on desktop), you gain access to a thing called "Console". As you visit any website, the actions your browser is performing during rendering the content may manifest here. Especially when some error occurs, a red text may appear here giving hints to developers about the cause.
